intro: Brachypodium mucronatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf basketgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a rough texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Brachypodium mucronatum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
